thread.title: The PGA Tour’s Plan to Get More—and Younger—Fans

author: Brian Costa
title: The PGA Tour’s Plan to Get More—and Younger—Fans
text:
For decades, professional golf has had a stable business model. Corporate sponsors pay millions to put their names on tournaments in deals that also require them to buy commercial time during broadcasts. That, in turn, drives more revenue to the PGA Tour through broadcast-rights deals.
But as with all professional sports, the landscape for the Tour is growing more complex. Traditional television viewership is in decline. Even as tournaments will pay out a record $363 million in prize money this season, Tour executives are... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
